name: AVIF image format
description: A modern image format based on the [AV1 video format](/av1). AVIF generally has better compression than [WebP](/webp), JPEG, PNG and GIF and is designed to supersede them. AVIF competes with [JPEG XL](/jpegxl) which has similar compression quality and is generally seen as more feature-rich than AVIF.

links.title: AVIF for Next-Generation Image Coding - blog post
Firefox support bug for image sequence and animation

byNum.1: Can be enabled in Firefox via the `image.avif.enabled` pref in `about:config`.
byNum.2: Supports still images. Animated image sequences are not supported.
byNum.3: Only available on macOS 13 Ventura or later.
byNum.4: Does not support images with noise synthesis.
byNum.5: Supports only still images by default. Animated image sequences can be enabled via the `image.avif.sequence.enabled` pref in `about:config`.
byNum.6: Can be enabled via the `--enable-features=msEdgeAVIF` runtime flag in insider channels.
